Package cs735_835.noc

Class Message

java.lang.Object
cs735_835.noc.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Message>
@ThreadSafe
public class Message
extends Object
implements Comparable<Message>
A message. Messages are generated by cores and routed through routers and wires to other cores. Each message has a source, a destination, an id, and 2 timestamps (send and receive times). Instances of this class are thread-safe.

  • Constructor Details

    • Message

      public Message​(int id, int scheduledTime, int sourceRow, int sourceCol, int destRow, int destCol)
      Builds a new message. The message is not tracked.
      Parameters:
      scheduledTime - the time at which the message will be sent (i.e., generated by a core); it must be positive
      sourceRow - the row the message will originate from
      sourceCol - the column the message will originate from
      destRow - the destination row
      destCol - the destination column
      id - the message identity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if scheduledTime is not positive

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Message m)
      The natural order of messages, which is increasing order of ids.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Message>

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object o)
      Message equality. Two messages are equal if the have the same id.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Hash code. This is the message id.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A string representation of the message. It is built exactly as follows: 
       msg <id> (never sent)
      or 
       msg <id> sent by (<source row>, <source col>) at <send time> (never delivered)
      or 
       msg <id> sent by (<source row>, <source col>) at <send time>, delivered to (<dest row>, <dest col>) at <receive time>
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

      public int sourceRow()
      Message source (row).

      Message source (col).

      Message destination (row).

      public int destCol()
      Message destination (col).

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Message identity.

    • isTracked

      public boolean isTracked()
      Tracking status. Simulators display information about tracked messages as they travel the network.

    • setTracked

      public void setTracked​(boolean set)
      Sets the tracking status.

    • getScheduledTime

      public int getScheduledTime()
      The time at which the message is scheduled to be sent. This is the time when the message should be generated by a core and injected into the core queue to be picked up by the router. It is set at construction time and never changes.

    • getSendTime

      public int getSendTime()
      The time at which this message was sent (that is, when the send method was called). It is -1 if the message has not been sent. Once it is nonnegative, its value never changes.

    • getReceiveTime

      public int getReceiveTime()
      The time at which this message was received (that is, when the receive method was called). It is -1 if the message has not been received. Once it is nonnegative, the value never changes and is guaranteed to be larger or equal to getSendTime().

    • send

      public void send​(int time)
      Marks the message as being sent. This method can only be called once.
      Parameters:
      time - the sending time, which must be positive
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this message has already been sent
      IllegalArgumentException - if time is not positive

    • receive

      public void receive​(int time)
      Marks the message as being received. This method can only be called once.
      Parameters:
      time - the reception time, which must be positive
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this message has already been received or was never sent
      IllegalArgumentException - if time is not positive or comes before sending time

    • hasBeenReceived

      public boolean hasBeenReceived()
      Whether this message has been received.

    • hasBeenSent

      public boolean hasBeenSent()
      Whether this message has been sent.

    • readMessagesFromURL

      public static List<Message> readMessagesFromURL​(URL url) throws IOException
      Parses a URL into a list of messages. The syntax of the source is one message per line, as follows: 
       id (row_sender, col_sender) (row_receiver, col_receiver) send_time
      or 
       id (row_sender, col_sender) (row_receiver, col_receiver) send_time *
      Times are positive integers. Empty lines and whitespaces are ignored. In the second form, the message is marked as being "tracked" and information about it will be displayed as it is being routed. Messages are listed in the order in which they appear in the source and are all unsent and unreceived.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • uniformRandomTraffic

      public static void uniformRandomTraffic​(long seed, int width, int height, double rate, int count)
      A utility method to generate messages with a uniform distribution. The messages are printed on System.out in non-decreasing order of their sending times.
      Parameters:
      rate - the rate at which messages are generated (in messages per cycle)
      count - the number of messages
      seed - the seed used for random number generation
      width - the width of the network; sources and destination will have a column between 0 and width - 1
      height - the height of the network; sources and destination will have a row between 0 and height - 1

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Command-line application to generate random lists of messages. It is called as: 
      Message <width> <height> <rate> <count>
      It calls method uniformRandomTraffic with a seed equal to 735835
      See Also:
      uniformRandomTraffic(long, int, int, double, int)
